item.title: PHP date times
item.description: What is timestamp? A timestamp is the number of seconds from January 1, 1970 at 00:00. <?php //output number of seconds from Jan 1, 1970 at 00:00. echo time(); echo date("d/m/y")."\n"; $now = getdate(); echo $now["hours"]+8; //print_r ($now); // 'z' is indexed from 0, so it is necessary to add 1. $numDays = date("z", mktime(0,0,0,12,31,2020))+1; $numWeeks = date("W", mktime(0,0,0,12,31,2020)); echo "There are $numDaysdays and $numWeeksweeks in 2020.\n"; How to display the current date/time?
